“Hello there, stranger! Welcome to my site!! My name is Adnan Hoq. I am currently working as Tarifica's Lead Data Scientist. I completed my BS in Mathematics & Computer Science from St. Joseph's College NY with a 4.0 GPA. I was the class Valedictorian. I am also an experienced full stack developer and data analyst. My future objectives include earning a PhD in Computer Science while working in the fields of computational social science, data management and ethics, and machine learning. Other future goals include writing and editing a feature length Hollywood film, becoming an elite home chef by day, and a master mixologist by night; the list goes on and on! I am determined to get most of the items on this list checked off before I'm 35. Aside from my academic and professional pursuits, I frequently indulge myself in the art of filmmaking. I like to explore and harness my skills and creativity as an amateur screenwriter and editor every now and then. Additionally, I enjoy going to broadway shows and watching indie films. Also, love reading books. Currently, stuck in an existentialist rabbit hole.”

Projects

GraphThink

A webapp that allows users to store insights and keywords as nodes and relationships in a Neo4j database. Users can also visualize the stored insights as nodes and relationships using vis.js. Moreover, users are able to run different graph algorithms on the stored data. I used python’s Flask framework for the webapp with HTML5 and CSS for the frontend.

GDP Dashboard

A dashboard to breakdown and visualize different countries’ GDPs and related factors in multiple interactive visualization. I created the dashboard using python’s DASH framework with HTML5 and CSS for the frontend.

WBO

A custom open-source python package, available on Mac and Windows machine. This is a command line tool (using python’s click package). The package scrapes box office mojo's Worldwide Box Office data using BeatifulSoup and Selenium. The package allows the user to download box office data for any range of years with all the available variables in a .csv file. User can also produce interactive html plots using this package. For visualization and plotting the package uses python’s plotly.js library.

Stop, Question, Frisk

A replication and extension project from the Microsoft Research Data Science Summer School class of 2019. A data analysis replication study of a widely-cited academic paper on racial bias in police use of force. Findings from the research paper were replicated by employing data wrangling, visualization, and modeling techniques using tidyverse, ggplot2, data.table, modelr, ROCR in R.
